ai.summary: A 9.7 km moderately paced hike along the Dollis Valley Greenwalk in the UK, weaving through parks, woodlands and riverside paths. The route offers urban–green scenery with gentle gradients and a mix of surfaces, making it accessible to walkers with basic fitness.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily paved paths, gravel trails and grassy verges. Mostly flat with a few gentle inclines; some sections may be muddy after rain and the riverbank can be uneven.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for 2–3 hours at a moderate pace. Wear sturdy footwear and weather-appropriate clothing. Stay on marked paths and be mindful of cyclists on shared sections. Check the weather forecast and daylight hours before you go, and bring a map or offline navigation. Carry water and snacks, plus a small first-aid kit. If you are near busy urban areas, stay aware of traffic and other pedestrians, especially at crossings.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing and a lightweight rain jacket
Phone with charged battery and a portable charger
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) are ideal for comfortable conditions; the route can be hiked year-round with appropriate gear.

seo.title: Dollis Valley Greenwalk – 9.7 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore a 9.7 km moderate hike along the Dollis Valley Greenwalk in the UK. Scenic riverside paths, parks and light woodland, with practical safety tips and gear recommendations.
